intro: Navarretia propinqua, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, bloom in early spring and are followed by small, lantern-shaped seed pods. Navarretia propinqua is an annual plant that is often found in disturbed habitats and is known for its delicate appearance.
